Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Looking at the table, lets start with Case 101. The first event is 2024-03-01 08:00 and the last is 10:15 the same day. So from 08:00 to 10:15 is 2 hours and 15 minutes. Then Case 102 starts at 08:05 and closes on March 2nd at 09:15. Thats over a day later, so definitely longer. Case 103 is from 08:10 to 09:30 same day, about 1 hour 20 minutes. Case 104 starts at 08:20 and closes next day at 08:30, so around 24 hours. Case 105 starts at 08:25 and closes on March 3rd at 09:30, which is two days later.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So the average might be around a few hours, but Cases 102, 104, and 105 are taking much longer. Lets quantify the times: Case 101: 2h15m Case 102: ~25h10m (from 08:05 to next day 09:15) Case 103: 1h20m Case 104: ~24h10m Case 105: ~48h5m So 102, 104, 105 are significantly longer.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Now, looking at their activities. Case 102 has an escalation to Level-2. The time between Assign to Level-1 (09:00) and Escalate (11:30) is 2.5 hours. Then from Escalate to Investigate (14:00) same day, 2.5 hours. Then Resolve next day at 09:00, which is 19 hours later. Thats a big wait.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Maybe the Level-2 agent took time to pick it up or investigate. Case 104: After Assign to Level-1 at 09:30, Investigate at 13:00 (3.5 hours wait), then Resolve next day at 08:00 (19 hours wait). No escalation, but long waits before investigate and resolve. Case 105: Assigned at 09:00, then Investigate at 09:10 (quick), then Escalate at 10:00. Then a long wait until March 2nd 14:00 to investigate again (over 24 hours), then Resolve on March 3rd. So the escalation led to a very long delay in Level-2 investigation.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Potential root causes: Escalations (cases 102, 105) leading to longer processing times, possibly because Level-2 agents are busy or take longer. Also, in cases without escalation (like 104), there are long waits between steps, maybe due to agent availability or workload. Wait times between activities: For example, in Case 102, after escalation, the investigation happens same day but then resolve is next day. In Case 104, after investigation, resolve is next day. Maybe agents are not working on weekends or evenings? Or maybe theres a handoff delay.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Proposals: Improve escalation process efficiency, ensure Level-2 agents have capacity, reduce waiting times by better scheduling or prioritization. Maybe automate triage to quicker assign complex cases to Level-2 sooner. Analyze agent workload and add more resources if necessary.
